1.brief: Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
strength in various applications (force, security, majesty, praise)
probably to brighten up, i.e. (figuratively) be (causatively, make) blithe or gleesome
something saved, i.e. (abstractly) deliverance; hence, aid, victory, prosperity

properly, interrogative what? (including how? why? when?); but also exclamation, what! (including how!), or indefinitely what (including whatever, and even relatively, that which); often used with prefixes in various adverbial or conjunctive senses
properly, to spin round (under the influence of any violent emotion), i.e. usually rejoice, or (as cringing) fear
properly, vehemence, i.e. (with or without preposition) vehemently; by implication, wholly, speedily, etc. (often with other words as an intensive or superlative; especially when repeated)

2.brief: a longing; by implication, a delight (subjectively, satisfaction, objectively, a charm)
the heart; also used (figuratively) very widely for the feelings, the will and even the intellect; likewise for the centre of anything
to give, used with greatest latitude of application (put, make, etc.)
the lip (as a natural boundary); by implication, language; by analogy, a margin (of a vessel, water, cloth, etc.)
properly, a failure; by implication nothing; usually (adverb) not at all; also lest
to debar (negatively or positively) from benefit or injury

3.brief: (by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed
to project (one self), i.e. precede; hence, to anticipate, hasten, meet (usually for help)

good (as an adjective) in the widest sense; used likewise as a noun, both in the masculine and the feminine, the singular and the plural (good, a good or good thing, a good man or woman; the good, goods or good things, good men or women), also as an adverb (well)
to place (in a very wide application)
the head (as most easily shaken), whether literal or figurative (in many applications, of place, time, rank, itc.)

4.brief: alive; hence, raw (flesh); fresh (plant, water, year), strong; also (as noun, especially in the feminine singular and masculine plural) life (or living thing), whether literally or figuratively
to inquire; by implication, to request; by extension, to demand
properly, a part of; hence (prepositionally), from or out of in many senses
to give, used with greatest latitude of application (put, make, etc.)
a day (as the warm hours), whether literal (from sunrise to sunset, or from one sunset to the next), or figurative (a space of time defined by an associated term), (often used adverb)
properly, concealed, i.e. the vanishing point; generally, time out of mind (past or future), i.e. (practically) eternity; frequentatively, adverbial (especially with prepositional prefix) always
properly, a (peremptory) terminus, i.e. (by implication) duration, in the sense of advance or perpetuity (substantially as a noun, either with or without a preposition)

5.brief: great (in any sense); hence, older; also insolent
properly, weight, but only figuratively in a good sense, splendor or copiousness
something saved, i.e. (abstractly) deliverance; hence, aid, victory, prosperity
grandeur (i.e. an imposing form and appearance)
properly, to level, i.e. equalize; figuratively, to resemble; by implication, to adjust (i.e. counterbalance, be suitable, compose, place, yield, etc.)
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications

6.brief: (by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed
to place (in a very wide application)
properly, a (peremptory) terminus, i.e. (by implication) duration, in the sense of advance or perpetuity (substantially as a noun, either with or without a preposition)
properly, nearness (used only as a preposition or an adverb), near; hence, generally, with, by, at, among, etc.
the face (as the part that turns); used in a great variety of applications (literally and figuratively); also (with prepositional prefix) as a preposition (before, etc.)

7.brief: (by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed
figuratively, to trust, be confident or sure
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
kindness; by implication (towards God) piety; rarely (by opposition) reproof, or (subject.) beauty
an elevation, i.e. (adj.) lofty (compar.); as title, the Supreme
properly, a failure; by implication nothing; usually (adverb) not at all; also lest
to waver; by implication, to slip, shake, fall

8.brief: properly, to come forth to, i.e. appear or exist; transitively, to attain, i.e. find or acquire; figuratively, to occur, meet or be present
a hand (the open one (indicating power, means, direction, etc.),
properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense)
the right hand or side (leg, eye) of a person or other object (as the stronger and more dexterous); locally, the south
properly, to come forth to, i.e. appear or exist; transitively, to attain, i.e. find or acquire; figuratively, to occur, meet or be present

9.brief: to place (in a very wide application)
time, especially (adverb with preposition) now, when, etc.
the face (as the part that turns); used in a great variety of applications (literally and figuratively); also (with prepositional prefix) as a preposition (before, etc.)
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
properly, the nose or nostril; hence, the face, and occasionally a person; also (from the rapid breathing in passion) ire
to make away with (specifically by swallowing); generally, to destroy

10.brief: the earth (at large, or partitively a land)
properly, to wander away, i.e. lose oneself; by implication to perish (causative, destroy)
seed; figuratively, fruit, plant, sowing-time, posterity
a son (as a builder of the family name), in the widest sense (of literal and figurative relationship, including grandson, subject, nation, quality or condition, etc., (like father or brother), etc.)
ruddy i.e. a human being (an individual or the species, mankind, etc.)

11.brief: (by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed
to stretch or spread out; by implication, to bend away (including moral deflection); used in a great variety of application
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
bad or (as noun) evil (natural or moral)

properly, to plait or interpenetrate, i.e. (literally) to weave or (generally) to fabricate; figuratively, to plot or contrive (usually in a malicious sense); hence (from the mental effort) to think, regard, value, compute
a plan, usually evil (machination), sometimes good (sagacity)
properly, a failure; by implication nothing; usually (adverb) not at all; also lest
to be able, literally (can, could) or morally (may, might)

12.brief: (by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed
to place (in a very wide application)
the neck (between the shoulders) as the place of burdens; figuratively, the spur of ahill
a cord (of a tent); or the string (of a bow)

properly, to be erect (i.e. stand perpendicular); hence (causatively) to set up, in a great variety of applications, whether literal (establish, fix, prepare, apply), or figurative (appoint, render sure, proper or prosperous)
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
the face (as the part that turns); used in a great variety of applications (literally and figuratively); also (with prepositional prefix) as a preposition (before, etc.)

13.brief: to be high actively, to rise or raise (in various applications, literally or figuratively)
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
strength in various applications (force, security, majesty, praise)
play upon it; to make music, accompanied by the voice; hence to celebrate in song and music
force (literally or figuratively); by implication, valor, victory

14.brief: to be high actively, to rise or raise (in various applications, literally or figuratively)
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
strength in various applications (force, security, majesty, praise)
play upon it; to make music, accompanied by the voice; hence to celebrate in song and music
force (literally or figuratively); by implication, valor, victory
